_header: Who shall give unto mine head a well
_description: John Lydgate, ‘A lamentacioun of our lady Maria’ — in 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) with varying refrain

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
Who shal yeve vn to myn hed a welleof bitter terys my sorwys to
                    compleyne…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…But shewe to them his mercy and his graceThat for ther love
                    was naylled to a tre
BodLauMis683.Attributed Title: HEre begynneth a lamentacioun of our lady (f. 78)
BodLauMis683.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 324-9.

BLHar2251.First Lines:
Who shal gyve vnto my hede a welleOf bitter teeris my sorw to
                    compleyne…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…But shew to the his mercy and his graceThat for theyr love
                    was nayled to a tre
BLHar2251.Attributed Title: Quis dabit capiti meo fontem lacarimus (f. 42v)

BLHar2255.First Lines:
Who shal give vnto myn heed a welleOf bittir teerys my sorwes to
                    compleyne…
BLHar2255.Last Lines:
…but shewe to them his mercy and his graceThat for ther love
                    was nailed to a tre
BLHar2255.Attributed Title:
Quis dabit capiti / meo fontem lacarimus (f. 66v, in
                    margin, in rubric)
BLHar2255.Editions:
Holthausen,  Ferdinand. 
             Liebe des Vokes: eine Festschrift zum sechzijährigen Jubiläum
                der…Franz Joseph I.
            Karl Gerstenberger von Reichsegg, ed. 
         Vienna, 1908.
